Matthew S
Nigeria is an example of what the United States could become if the religious nut cases continue to gain power here.

post_info.post_title: Welcome to the United States If the Fundies Continue gaining power

Symbiote

Nigeria is an example of what happens when the government continues to gain power, whether gays, racial groups or any other section of the population is stepped on, the result is no less tragic.
 
 When the government feels it has the moral backing to do whatever it thinks will serve it best, it is certain some group will be victimised, while gays are a popular group to target, they are not the only one. And a pro-gay totalitarian system is no more humane than an anti-gay one.
 
 Do not interpret this as support for gay oppression, rather that any moral opposition to oppression of gays must also reject oppression of other groups, for example women or christians.
Jo Bennett

Are you sure you're thinking of Nigeria, symbiote? Nigeria is currently pretty democratic. The problem, to my mind, is that there are two religious groups, Christian and Muslim; both or which are fairly extreme in outlook. The Anglican Archbishop of Nigeria has made some pretty unpleasent statements about gay people, and has severed links with Canterbury over gay rights. There are a lot of Muslims in Nigeria who want Sharia law imposed. Being homophobic is something that unites both sides.
Steeeeve
if it were democratically done then why deny this? I may not agree but the alternative to a democracy is not that great.
Matthew S

if it were democratically done then why deny this? I may not agree but the alternative to a democracy is not that great.

It is kinda like someone going up to you and saying "DO YOU DO DRUGS!!!" in a yelling tone...you immediatly go on the defensive instead of actually listening to any point the person is trying to make.
